content:
How do people feel about arranging a kick off synchronous design meeting? :-)

I think we have at least three somewhat intersecting topics to discuss:

  • how to represent syntax trees? (IDE wants full-fidelity trees a-la Roslyn, macros want token trees)
  • how to identify stuff in a salsa-friendly way (spans vs node ids vs source maps)
  • how the interface for name resolution could look like?
Another interesting topic, "what are the inputs", I feel we've covered at all hands.
:+1: , also I think how to handle / represent diagnostics will be interesting?
I'm very into this idea
I've been thinking about doing similar things for trait wg
Do you plan to do it in Zulip, @matklad ?
(If not, we could use Zoom and record it)
My hope is that we can create some setup which permits people to kind of follow along with high-level design by attending (or following) a high-level meeting
I don't know. Zoom is higher bandwidth, Zulip is more async friendly. I think I'd personally try zullip
it might be a good idea to restrict each meeting to one specific topic. I think all of the suggested topics are interesting and they are complicated enough to warrant a full meeting.

Good call. So let's stick to one!

@WG-rls2.0 how about "how to represent syntax trees?" meeting on Zulip next week (time to be determined via doodle)?

it might be a good idea to restrict each meeting to one specific topic. I think all of the suggested topics are interesting and they are complicated enough to warrant a full meeting.

yes, this is exactly what I wanted to suggest
I would suggest making up a list of design topics, and thinking a bit carefully about the order
and then each week picking up the next thing in the list, adjusting as you go
at least, that is what I had planned to do
@matklad where is the doodle poll? (or does it not exist yet)
does not exist yet, I am trying to figure it out ;)
@WG-rls2.0 poll to figure out the meeting time: https://doodle.com/poll/53ea9c2666bsdh93#table
creating a paper with a list of topics: https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/Topics-to-cover-in-sync-design-meetings--AXjibR1OZQ1qMzXGCX3x7ApcAQ-fpcfA5CM2kYb7L39YkbdC

Looks like Wednesday, 14:00 -- 15:00 UTC works for everyone!

@nikomatsakis there's a compiler teem calendar. How can I add this event to it?
BTW is the meeting going to be a text-based chat in a Zulip topic (similar to how the rustc T-compiler team meetings go?)
This is the plan, yeah
@WG-rls2.0 there's now an event for the meeting in compiler team calendar: https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?src=6u5rrtce6lrtv07pfi3damgjus%40group.calendar.google.com
I guess we can have some kind of email alias for working group to automatically send invitation to events, but I don't know everyone's email.
we could also create a zulip user group alias
I wish there was a way for those to be something that people can subscribe themselves to
I guess we could open an issue on the zulip repo
There's already WG-rls2.0 zulip alias. But I can't add people to calendar event using this alias? Or is there an email-address associated with zulip group?
@matklad oh, no, sorry. I just meant that you can ping people on Zulip
but they can subscribe themselves to the calendar and get notifications etc
(though I wonder if we want >1 calendar)
there may be a better tool for managing this, it feels a bit absurd
Yeah, I guess it's better to stick to the model where "source of truth" is Zulip, and you are supposed to listen to WG pings. Hopefullly this will be enough for folks not to forget about the meetings
